subject: Politics
title: Gerrymandering
description: A quick, practical guide to Gerrymandering.

hook.text: Politicians choose their voters instead of voters choosing politicians. That's gerrymandering in a sentence.

buildup.text: Gerrymandering redraws district boundaries to give one party an unfair advantage in elections.

discovery.text: By packing opponents into few districts or spreading them thin, mapmakers predetermine election outcomes.

twist.text: Both parties do it. After each census, whichever party controls a state redraws lines in its favor.

climax.text: Independent commissions can fix it, but politicians rarely give up the power to choose their voters.

punchline.text: Gerrymandering is legal cheating. It rigs elections without breaking laws.

quiz.question: What is the purpose of gerrymandering?
options: To redraw district boundaries for one party's electoral advantage
To increase voter turnout in all districts
To create equal population in every district
